We all pray that at first. But who stays content when others have more?
(smiles) I was content, with what you would call nothing. I may be content again. Here. He looks out over the praying Ibelin Muslims. All in submission to God, bowing in unison.
They submit...we must decide. They have it easier. (gently) You did not decide on Guy.
(unhappily, firmly) My first husband was chosen by my father. I cannot complain, since my son was the result, but that is retrospection. My first husband died before his son was born.
I have seen your son.
He is not strong. And he will be the king. (she thinks sadly about her son, then presses on) Guy was chosen by my mother. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

The Kingdom needed new blood. My mother took what was available at the time. (near tears and wanting to be alone) I have not decided very much in my days. One learns not to want. They submit to God. I submit to the Kingdom of Jerusalem. Good night.
Good night. SIBYLLA goes along the gallery. BALIAN watches her go.

BALIAN dismounts and, boots in the furrowed dry earth, wa his horse respectfully past the praising MUSLIMS. Squinti against the late sun. A note of paradise. MUSLIMS pray, J and CHRISTIANS work together in the fields. Ibelin is a microcosm of the kingвЂ™s Jersualem--the better world.
SIBYLLA is sitting in an archway, knees up, looking out a the water. BALIAN come in, dusty. Brass chimes turn and tinkle in th wind.
I could stay here...perhaps not forever... but a little while longer.
This house is yours.
(staring into the light) Why am I here? BALIAN sits down beside her.
I know that Ibelin is not on the way to Cana. Sibylla smiles. Her eyes luminous.
What else do you know, my lord? (CONTINUED)
I know that your are a princess and that I am no lord. Nor do I wish to be.
You are a knight.
Not proved. Sibylla looks up at Balian.

I do not stay on here with you because I am bored, or wicked. I am here because... in the East... one may decide... (a beat) ...-because in the East between one person and another there is only light. BALIAN raises her face and kisses her. He carries against a pillar. INT. THE ROOFTOP вЂњBEDROOMвЂќ AT IBELIN. NIGHT 67. her back SIBYLLA, sitting in the bed, takes one by one the rings f her hennaed hands.
This is from France, which I have not seen...I have never been to France...This for my brother...This to remind us of death...This I bought the day I saw you...

You lie. SIBYLLA laughs, admitting it, gets up on her knees, puts ring on a chain she has take from around her neck and put around his neck and kisses him. Leaving Balian staring af her she goes to the window, wrapped in silk, and takes up broken pomegranate from the table. With a silver in she e the seeds. BALIAN goes and takes the in from her, and set the POMERGRANATE down. Sibylla looks up at him.
But IвЂ™m hungry. (CONTINUED)
He kisses her. BalianвЂ™s been out of the game for a whil carries her back to the bed.

CAMELS laden with dyed goods move along, bells tinkling. Three of the merchantвЂ™s daughters ride in camel howdahs A MUSLIM TRADING CARAVAN moves across the wide desert. Tw hundred camels. it has with it a small force of calvary, riding in a file. A HILLTOP. TWO RIDERS CREST IT. GUY and REYNALD sit their horses and stare towards the Muslims. They are at the head of a little over 50 knights including fanatical TEMPLARS. Destriers restless. Ready a the men are to fight.
(near-sighted) Do you see them?

(smoothly) How could I? I am not here. (a beat) This caravan is armed, Reynald. A CRY FROM BELOW as they are spotted. The MUSLIM FORCE spreads out, arches on horseback, forming a line between Crusaders and the now hastening caravan. The TEMPLAR MAST rides up beside them. Bloodthirsty.
God wills it. REYNALD draws his sword. A ride detaches and streaks away across the desert. GUY notices.
A rider got away.
(unconcerned) ItвЂ™s a broad desert. Nothing will of it. Nothing... (laughs ) or the apocalypse. (CONTINUED)
I prefer to not be hanged before my wife is queen.
Does that make you king? I have never been sure.
Close enough.
(riding along the ridge) DonвЂ™t worry. Who but Reynald? they will say. ItвЂ™s always me! (belches ) They will believe it at Jerusalem, I assure you. And Damascus. You were at Nazareth, praying.
(drawing sword) You're a clever man.
On the other hand, how long can the leper last? Not long. If the war is to be now or later I would have it now. GUY nods. HeвЂ™s thinking that as well.

Now. 69. The KNIGHTS charge. Reverse it. The CAMELS and people are running. Men grabbing weapons of every kind. The heavy knights smash through the defenders, killing everyone the come near. People trying to surrender are killed. We TEMPLARS killing with particular savagery. Leave the the dust, the knights murdering, the camels running, and silver spilling...ItвЂ™s over almost at once. GUY, with blood, wheels his horse. see the fight in silks covered REYNALD rides up to: The MUSLIM GRANDEE. The man he paid at the palace.
You. He splits him in half.  70.

head_text.subj: EXT. THE ROOFTOP BEDROOM AT IBELIN. DAWN

text: Wind is rising. BALIAN covers Sibylla with more blankets. stares hauntedly, hollowly. She has been crying. Stares o
Why do you cry?
Because I go in the morning.
Stay.
I have a dying brother, and a child who will be king. CLOSE ON BALIAN, CONSIDERING THIS ENORMOUS FACT.
As for us, the world will decide. The world always decides.

A dust storm rising. Wind in the palms. SibyllaвЂ™s lance mounted. BALIAN helps Sibylla into the saddle. They are awkward, observed, infinitely sad. As she bitterly turns her horse there is a commotion OS. People pointing. BALIAN leaves Sibylla and moves through the crowd to see: BALIANвЂ™S POV: A MUSLIM in a blood-stained gown is stumbling through the palms, crying for water, for help BALIAN stares as his people rush forward and we go to:

head_text.subj: INT. THE THRONE ROOM. JERUSALEM. DAY

text: An assembly of the powers of the land. Set up like the Ho of Commons, with Templars and GuyвЂ™s party on one side, Hospitalers and loyalists on the other. The king wearing mask of silver, looking at GUY and TIBERIAS, who stand be him.
Maybe Reynald did attack a caravan. But what of it? War is inevitable. Peace...unnatural. (CONTINUED)
(like a man speaking in tongues ) It was no caravan. It was an army headed for Bethlehem to desecrate the birthplace of Our Lord.
(exasperated) Reynald, with the Templars, I am sure--
Lie! Lie!
..-have broken the kingвЂ™s pledge of peace. Saladin will come into this kingdom...
Tiberias knows more than a Christian should about SaladinвЂ™s intentions. Uproar among the BARONS. TIBERIAS goes close to GUY.
What do you say?
That you love the Saracens. A close moment. TIBERAIS very close to Guy.
That I would rather live with people than kill them is certainly why you are alive.
That sort of Christianity has its uses. I suppose.
(to court) We cannot have war with Saladin. We will not win it. And, yes, we do not want it.
Blashpemy, blasphemy. (CONTINUED)
Blasphemy. An army of Jesus Christ which bears his holy cross cannot be beaten. Does the Count of Tiberias suggest that it could be? An uproar among the divided parties.
There must be war. God wills it.
God wills it. God wills it. God wills it.

(roaring at the whole court) Then pray Jerusalem that God will win it, for in the end we shall not. The hall falls silent. A MESSENGER has entered. He moves forward, and speaks to the King. The King raises his mask face.
Saladin has crossed the Jordan. With two hundred thousand men.
He will go first for Kerak. The king starts to rise.
Assemble the Army.
Your majesty...If you travel you will die. GUY, overhearing this, looks pleased.
Assemble the Army.

Dust is blowing through the tangled corpses of men and horses. BALIANвЂ™S MEN pick through the wreckage. BALIAN вЂњsolvingвЂќ the fight. What horses came from which dire BALIAN dismounts and examines a dead horse. (CONTINUED)
(examining it) ThatвЂ™s not a wound. The brand is cut off.
Reynald did this. His castle of Kerak is ten leagues. Fifteen... A cry OS: A SOLDIER is driving off vultures.

The Christian bodies hid. Here. In a natural ditch, hastily covered, stripped European bodies, half-buried. The sand blows across them. As BALIA stares down: SIBYLLA rides up behind him and stares equably at the bod What sort of woman is this? A woman of her time. JACKALS loping towards the dead.
We must send a rider to the King. Unless my lady will take the news to Jerusalem.
No. I am staying with you.
(holding her bridle) I am going to Kerak. Reynald did this.
Not alone, I think. Not alone. ON SOUND: A BELL CLANGING ALARM.

head_text.subj: EXT. THE VALLEY OF KERAK. DAY

text: A LINE OF REFUGEES are streaming towards the castle, thro a rubbly village being evacuated in haste. People loading mules, camels. Some simply running.

location: A HILL ABOVE THE VALLEY OF KERAK. CONTINUOUS

text: BALIAN crests the hill, mounted, followed by the entire garrison of Ibelin (50 mounted men). In the distance down valley: dust. (CONTINUED)

The calvary will come up the valley to close Reynald in, and the siege army will come behind it. BALIAN looks at the refugees straggling across the desert he does he sees: MUSLIM HORSE are coming up the valley. O parties of calvary appear in all directions. He turns to SIBYLLA.
Princesses are not killed. Somewhere it is written down.

Go into the fortress. Now. SIBYLLA is a woman of her time: she too has seen the cava in every direction: nods. She kisses BALIAN, looks him in eye, and then gallops off, her lancers with her. BALIAN rides a little forward, staring. MOTHERS with chil running through the dust.
KERAKвЂ™S BELL is continuing to peal alarm as SIBYLLA and TURCOPOLES flash up through the gates.

Visitors! REYNALD, wearing a festive gown, and eating an orange, st indifferently at the desert. His personal Priest and confessor (a ragged, long suffering cleric) is with him. AT-ARMS are manning the walls. REYNALD (CONTвЂ™D) (grabs the priest, to use him as вЂњbinocularsвЂќ ) How many? REYNALDвЂ™S PRIEST I canвЂ™t see yet. Only a dust cloud...
(hands his goblet to the priest and pisses against a buttress) I serve God. That is what I do. If God tells me to raid Mecca then by God I raid Mecca. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)
That is the way things are done. And now itвЂ™s all this. Again.
MUSLIM HORSE move from a canter to a gallop. Sweeping up valley.
We see the first of the REFUGEES making it through the ga SIBYLLA stands on the ramparts, looking out.
I wish I were fifty again or that you drank liquor. What do you look at?
Knights.
(squints) What knights?

head_text.subj: EXT. THE VALLEY NEARER THE CASTLE. MOMENTS LATER

text: We see the streaming refugees, driving cattle, and heavy the women and children. Into the shot, BALIAN and knights They turn to face the oncoming Muslim cavalry, that rolli wall of dust. They walk forward through the refugees movi in the other direction. A RIDER comes up.
My lord prays you bring your knights into Kerak. BALIAN completely ignores him. The RIDER is mystified. Bu twigs it: Balian is going to delay the Muslim cavalry.
(staring towards Muslims) If we go into the castle, those people will die.
We cannot attack that force and live. (CONTINUED)
There must be a lie about how many Saracens one of us is worth in battle.
The commonest is ten.
Are you with me? ALMARIC nods and makes the sign of the cross. The KNIGHTS SERGEANTS cross themselves as well. BALIAN rides slowly forward at the head of his men.

head_text.subj: EXT. THE BATTLEMENTS OF KERKA. LATER

text: REYNALD, now being helped into his armor, stares towards south, still squinting and using the PRIEST as his вЂњbinocularsвЂќ.
They mean to charge that? They are better men than me. Not quite so bright, but better men than me. (to Sibylla) You know this fellow. Why is he doing this?
Because he is a knight, Reynald.
Hmmn. (turning away indifferently) Selah. (A Hebrew word from the Psalms, meaning, as he says it, вЂњSo be itвЂќ.) SIBYLLA, unexpectedly, crosses herself, and watches for t outcome.

head_text.subj: EXT. THE VALLEY OF KERAK. DAY

text: BALIAN advances with his thin line of heavy cavalry, now fully interposed between the Muslims and the refugees. Th Muslims are racing, but in contrast to them (going back t BALIAN) we should not mistake how very dangerous the heav knights are. (CONTINUED)

BALIAN spurs his horse up to a canter, and then as his me catch up, and, taking the вЂњhigh guardвЂќ (none of the k now using reins: the destriers know exactly what to do) gallops towards the Muslim force. The forces collide. The knights drive deep all across the front, killing, unhorsi scores of MUSLIMS, completely destroying the impetus of t Muslim cavalry. DESTRIERS smash down Arab horses. A KNIGH lanced off his horse. ARABS, in the hundreds, are hacked of the saddle. Arrows miss their targets. Men roll on the ground in the melee. The IBELIN MEN are grotesquely outnumbered but the have stopped the Muslim advance--for the moment.
REFUGEES stream in.

The inevitable end is near: There are too many Muslims. IBELIN MEN go down and are run down by horses or killed o seized by dismounted men. BALIAN wheels in the melee, killing. His HORSE is hamstri (we see the hatchet that does it), and he goes down. Immediately he is overwhelmed by Arabs, disarmed, beaten, dragged. Horses, whirling dust, screaming men. BALIAN is dragged, forced to his knees. He sees: ALMARIC, with a head wound, and some other of his men, kneeling, all threatened by yelling Muslims. BALIAN close his eyes, preparing to accept death, and lowers his head.
SIBYLLA turns away from what seems to be the imminent execution of Balian.

FINE BOOTS come forward through the dust. A SCIMITAR is drawn. BALIAN looks up and sees: the SCIMITAR raised as i behead him. He lowers his eyes and head. The sword impact ON HIS SHOULDER. The flat of it quivers there and is withdrawn. BALIAN looks up and sees: IMAD. The commander of SaladinвЂ™s cavalry. In beautiful Damascus armor, smiling at him. MUSLIMS stare. Do they ki these men? Do they not? Imad helps Balian to his feet. (CONTINUED)
You were not that manвЂ™s servant.

No. A MUSLIM hands BALIAN a waterskin. ALMARIC canвЂ™t believ is happening. The MUSLIMS draw back, murmuring. BALIAN no and drinks, then, with ImadвЂ™s nodded permission, takes water to a wounded man.
The PRIEST is watching.
They are letting them live.
(indifferent, swigs wine) Sometimes they are chivalrous. They learned it from us.
IMAD and BALIAN.

You may go into Kerak, but you will die there. My master is here. BALIAN looks past IMAD to higher ground (to one side of t valley of Kerak) and sees...the arrival of SALADINвЂ™S AR enormous line of men, mounted and unmounted, in perfect order, each section with its banner.
And ours, my lord. IMAD looks in the other direction. Far, far off he sees t glint of steel in dust. IMAD walks apart, staring and get onto hi horse to see better.

Tell my lord Saladin that Jerusalem is come. THE ARMY OF THE KINGDOM OF JERUSALEM. The KING rides in his litter alongside THE HOLY CROSS, covered with gold and jewels, passes through the streamin dust. 500 knights are marching towards the relief of Kera (CONTINUED)

They are flanked by and protected by 5,000 SPEARMEN and CROSSBOWMEN. Essentially the army is a moving square, tremendously disciplined. GUY is with the army. IMAD stares through the dust. A man breaks away from the Muslim line and rides up beside him. A small, slight, fig unarmored, in simple clothing. He scrutinizes Balian, his bloody men, then Imad.

Pull back your cavalry. As HORNS blow and the Muslims retire, leaving Balian and wounded, winded, men in the valley with a perfect view of events... THE ARMY OF JERUSALEM does an "evolution" and in one move it is transformed into a fighting line, facing the Muslim Army, about a quarter mile away. Out of the dust rides... BALIANвЂ™S POV: THE KING. THE KING, a brilliant horseman, is using every ounce of strength he still possesses to not only stay in the saddl but look as if he is still a living man, when in fact he essentially, already a dead one. He rides in front of his army, and raises his palm as he arrives before Saladin. SALADIN rides forward himself, so that they are very clos
I pray you retire unharmed to Damascus. SALADIN moves forward, looking closely at the dying king. knows how much effort this has cost the man.
Reynald of Chatillon will be punished. I swear it. Withdraw, or we all die here. SALADIN looks at the Army of Jerusalem. Then at the king.
I will send you my physicians. The KING lowers his head but only for a moment.
Do we have terms? (CONTINUED)
We have terms. The masked KING rides back to his army.
THE ARAB FORCE PARTS. BALIAN and his surviving men, relea to cheers from the battlements, ride out towards the gate the castle, which are opened.

head_text.subj: INT. THE COURTYARD AT KERAK. MOMENTS LATER

text: BALIAN and his men stagger in, acclaimed by the peasants have saved. Through the crowd comes Reynald.

You would have given me more mouths the feed and more shit to throw over the wall. You have a great deal to learn about sieges. REYNALD claps him on the arm. REYNALD (CONTвЂ™D) (whispering) But that was magnificent. BALIAN, looking up, sees SIBYLLA. She stands in an archwa Smiling down. BALIAN starts for Sibylla. At that moment...THE KING and party, including TIBERIAS and GUY, gallops through the ga of KERAK. Unable to go to Sibylla through the crowd, BALIAN pulls h ring on its chain from the throat of his armor, and kisse it. SIBYLLA nods. REYNALD knows heвЂ™s in for it. He drinks the last of the THE KING gets painfully from the saddle. The ride has kil him: has taken near the last of his strength. The King, walking to Reynald, dragging one leg, removes his turban. drops it on the ground. He walks towards Reynald, and tak off his mask. We do not see The KingвЂ™s destroyed face. Reynald does.
I am Jerusalem. (walks forward, unwrapping one of his hands) (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

Will you give me the kiss of peace, Reynald? The King holds out a ruined hand, with a ring on what rem of a finger. REYNALD kisses the hand. The King beats him a stick. Again, again, again, as GUY watches--terrified that Reyna might squeal. Guy looks up and sees: SIBYLLA. He follows her eyeline to: BALIAN. And he knows. He unties a glove with his teeth. PHYSICIANS grab the king, who almost faints. The KING is helped to his litter. The KING reaches out a hand to SIBYLLA...who recoils from him The KING, a tear falling, closes his eyes.
(to TIBERIAS) What are you looking at?
A dead man. Reynald of Chatillon, you are arrested and condemned. The KING is laid into his litter. A draught of medicine i poured into the mouthhole of the mask. The king gestures BALIAN.

(gently, almost dreamy) If you continue as you are I shall make you Marshal of Jerusalem. What do you think of that? Before Balian can respond, the KINGвЂ™S LITTER is carried TIBERIAS is beside BALIAN.
When a man says something on the edge of sleep one may discard it. When a king says it, it will happen. Mark you. BALIAN and TIBERIAS lock eyes. (CONTINUED)

Do not return to Ibelin. I need you in Jerusalem. SIBYLLA cannot join Balian in public; but she looks at hi GUY observes this. SIBYLLA, noticing her husband, looks a GUY expressionlessly, and retires into an archway and disappears.
(still mounted, moving through the crowd) GodfreyвЂ™s son charged ten thousand with a hundred men.

Did he... BALIAN is mobbed...by GUYвЂ™S MEN as much as anybody. TIB watches shrewdly as the shy BALIANвЂ™s popularity with th troops becomes more than obvious. INT. SALADINвЂ™S TENT ON THE ROAD TO DAMASCUS. NIGHT SALADIN saturnine, watchful, delicate with his food, is dining with IMAD and a still-astonished MULLAH.
The battle must come. You have promised to drive the Christians into the sea. You have not done so. SALADIN makes no response. He sips tea, staring into flam
Why did we retire? God could not favor him! God alone determines the results of battles.

The results of battles are determined by God. But also by preparation, numbers, the absence of disease, and the availability of water. (kindly) One cannot maintain a siege with the enemy behind. The MULLAH stares: heresy. (CONTINUED)
How many battles did God win for the Muslims before I came? (a courtly pause) Before, that is, God determined that I should come.
Few enough. (thinks about the reason) That is because we were sinful.
It is because you were unprepared.
If you think tha way you shall not be king for long.
(drily) When I am not king I quake for Islam. (he takes the MullahвЂ™s hands) Thank you for your visit.
(not leaving) You promised to return Jerusalem. SALADIN nods. The MULLAH goes. SALADIN stares into flame.
(softly) If I do not deliver war, I have no peace.

The king of Jerusalem will die soon. When he is dead, the boy will be king, and have no control of the kingdom. The Christians will make the war you need. SALADIN nods, frustrated, condemned. Neither man is happy with the realpolitik. OS the sounds of the camp, and pray
The domed city is under a dust-storm. Heavy wind. We hear wind-torn churchbells and together with them the Muslims to prayer.
THE BOY KING is riding around a garden on his SIBYLLA watching, careworn, with love. BELLS.

location: A WALL AND GATE OF JERUSALEM. CONTINUOUS

text: Wind is blowing dust in the faces of spitting 84. pony, laughing. workmen who are levering a great stone up a ramp. BALIAN and ALMARIC walk cloaked, supervising the works. TWO CLOAKED MEN go past, salaaming to the embarrassed Balian. A burkahed woman giv him an orange from her basket: A memory of Godfrey. He smiles. Climbs up the wall. GREAT PIPES (for Greek Fire) being swayed up. BALIAN watches, supervising.
My lord?
(still uncomfortable with the вЂњmy lordвЂќ business) Yes.
It is enough that you ask men-at- arms to push stones, and dig. It is worse to ask them to do it all day and night.
We have a dying king. We need strong walls. As for work, I want every man at arms to learn a trde.
A trade?
A trade. Shoemaker. Tanner. Carpenter. Joiner. Baker. Blacksmith. This strikes Almaric as unreasonable.
It is beneath their condition.
The first man to bring me a respectable pair of shoes I will make a knight. Smiles. Tosses Almaric the orange. (CONTINUED)

(rationalizing) Jesus was a tradesman, of course. Nothing could be more noble. Balian turns and sees: GUY at the head of his troops. A G LINE OF KNIGHTS AND MEN AT ARMS is parading through the g Guy very much at their head, coming in from a brief patro It is also a show of force in the city. Fascistic, powerf An image of GuyвЂ™s power in the Kingdom. BALIAN, windblo the wall with his own dusty, hard-working men at arms, an stares down, locking eyes with GUY, as the knights stream past.

head_text.subj: INT. HALLWAY IN THE CASTLE. LATER

text: GUY watches over a cup of wine as PHYSICIANS go into the KingвЂ™s rooms.
REYNALD is like a snarling lion in the dungeon.

(echoing) I am Reynald of Chatillon. I am Reynald of Chatillon! INT. THE KINGвЂ™S CHAMBERS. CONTINUOUS A PILLAR CANDLE is burning. The king, breathing laborious is washed by his silent physicians. INCENSE smokes in cen hanging all around the room.
The things we have left undone plague us as death comes. That is why to the dying there is no comfort but the Lord. The MASK turns to the side and the kings haunted eyes gli at: THE CHESSBOARD.
We must announced the boy as my successor. Go to Tiberias and tell him to come. The PATRIARCH nods.
Leave me.  86.

The PATRIARCH, coming out, nods at GUY. GUY sips wine, an moves along the hall. He goes to the door of SibyllaвЂ™s He hesitates, and then kicks in the door. INT. SIBYLLAвЂ™S ROOMS. CONTINUOUS The MAIDSERVANT stands in shock. She retreats a little.
Where is my wife? The MAIDSERVANT retreats. GUY smiles, and goes after her.

You sometimes dream you are my wife. Le us pretend you are my wife. The MAIDSERVANT simpers, ready for it. He rummages on a t and puts a little tiara crookedly on the poor girlвЂ™s he INT. BALIANвЂ™S HOUSE, BEDROOM. NIGHT A CANDLE lighted from a splinter of wood reveals: SIBYLLA She is bare-shouldered, her hair down, but careworn.
We cannot meet in the city.
Then we will leave it. SIBYLLA looks at him over her shoulder.

Balian...My brother is dying. My son will be King and I his regent. I must rule for my son. Not just in Jerusalem, but Acre, Ascalon, Beirut... CLOSE ON Balian as the candles gutter. He is afraid of wh heвЂ™s opened up.

And Guy? CLOSE ON SIBYLLA, thinking.  87. INT. SIBYLLAвЂ™S ROOMS. LATER Torchbearers comes in, GUARDS, and then Sibylla, cloaked. sees first...her boy playing with LEAD SOLDIERS...and the with a shock, GUY sitting in a chair. A bit worn out. Hol the handle of a dagger.
These rooms are not yours.
One day I will be the husband I was...commissioned to be.
And perhaps not. GUY knows that she refers to Bailian. He smiles thinly, e down.

Your lover has a hundred knights and the love of the king. I, the largest force in the Kingdom...the support of the Templars...and I can do without...the other. But your love... SIBYLLA knocks away his hand. Her GUARDS are standing the
Soon, we will come to an understanding. You need my knights. Or your sonвЂ™s rule will be bloody and brief. He leaves the torchlight and the room. SIBYLLA takes of h cloak, face white.
REYNALD, hair tangled, in soiled linen, is eating porridg with his fingers. He stops to yell his name. The doors op GUY. Still dusty from riding.
In the desert, I had a thought. (CONTINUED)
That is what the desert is for. Did you come to kill me for giving your name? Because I havenвЂ™t. And won't.
Be as much at peace as you can in here. You will not be here long.
And you? Do you think that the king really wants you at the head of the army when his is gone? Do you? GUY leans against the wall, thinking. REYNALD (CONTвЂ™D) Do you think your wife does?
I have a problem.
I saw him at Kerak. Celebrated.
Precisely.
You must beware of a popular man. As do, I think, the Templars.
Precisely. INT. THE KINGвЂ™S CHAMBERS. LATER BALIAN looks down at the dying king.

It is time to conclude my affairs. (a beat) You are the Marshal of Jerusalem. (BALIAN looks up) And you are a peer of this kingdom. Do you know what that means? BALIAN shakes his head вЂњnoвЂќ. TIBERIAS watches gravely
No one can rule a kingdom who cannot lead troops in battle. Tiberias will not live forever. (CONTINUED)
The KING sits up, stands, and under his own power goes to chair.

I cannot die with there being a chance of Guy taking power through my sister. He will make war against the Muslims, who are only too ready to take this Kingdom. Will you protect my nephew when he is king?
Yes.
Would you marry Sibylla were she free? BALIAN stares at the floor for a long time. He has been offered his desires. He finally looks up.
And Guy?
He will be executed on the instant you say yes. With all of his knights who do not swear to you. BALIAN must now give away the woman he loves.
I cannot be the cause of that.
You are not in your forge anymore, boy. Do it. The KING raises his hand for silence. TIBERIAS, exasperat leaves the room. THE KING watches BALIAN.
A king may move a man, you said. But the soul, you said, is the manвЂ™s. The KING (we can see it through the mouth-hole) smiles.
~..Yes.
You have my love. And my answer. (CONTINUED)

BALIAN takes the wrapped hands and bows. INT. THE HALL OUTSIDE THE KINGвЂ™S ROOMS. MOMENTS LATER TIBERIAS leans against the wall. BALIAN comes out OS. All Tiberias as he realizes: Balian possibly isnвЂ™t going to it.
(coming closer)
He has made me Marshal of Jerusalem. I will protect the kingdom, and the new king. To the rest, I have said no.
I understand. I do. But if you do not marry Sibylla--
I will not kill a man in cold blood or for profit.

(interrupts, pleading) Who is he that you save his life? HeвЂ™s a man who hates you, who has insulted you...I play Devil...but for the salvation of this kingdom. Compromise yourself. (Balian is backing away from him) Jerusalem does not need вЂњa perfect knightвЂќ. This is the world.
No...it is his kingdom, and it is my life. And both are kingdoms of conscience, or nothing. BALIAN moves on. He sees: GUY. GUY (who has not heard the previous) stares at him hollowly.

A hundred against ten thousand. Slow clapping from Guy. BALIAN gives the man whose life h has saved a long, long, look, and then continues on his w  gl. INT. THE COURTYARD AT BALIANвЂ™S HOUSE. CONTINUOUS Moonlight in the pool. BALIAN sits down and looks at the water. PALMS blow overhead, reminiscent of Ibelin. Horseв hooves, OS, and someone comes in behind Balian. BALIAN lo around. It is SIBYLLA, cloaked.
I see a man who could be great, unless he chooses to be вЂњgoodвЂќ. If you do not join with me, I am left with Guy.
You would see your husband dead.
For Jerusalem. For my son. For love.
What kind of вЂњloveвЂќ is that?
Who are you to refuse a king? You refuse my son.
I refuse to do murder. Especially of a man who stands between me and what I want. (Sibylla is shaken) And Jerusalem. Look into your heart. Do you have any idea of Jerusalem except that it is yours?

(a long pause, and an honest answer) It is mine. My grandfather took Jerusalem in blood. I will keep it in the same way, or any way I can, for my family, for my son. I am what I am. I offer you that, and the world...you say no.
Do you think I am Guy? That I would sell my sould for вЂњthe worldвЂќ, or even you? Do you think that I am a...thing...that can be used? SIBYLLA looks up at him. (CONTINUED)

I think you are a man. And I think there will be a day when you wish you had done a little evil, to doa greater good. SIBYLLA exits. BALIAN stares after her. INT. SIBYLLAвЂ™S ROOMS. LATER PUSH through the rooms to find SIBYLLA. She crushes a ros stem and all, and the blood rills down her wrist.

THE WATERWHEEL TURNS, spilling water into a ditch which r off into the fields. BALIAN, covered with dust, looks at wheel turning. Then at the crops. IBELIN KIDS are staring him. He wander out of shot. INT. SIBYLLAвЂ™S ROOMS. NIGHT SIBYLLA is showing her son a GLOBE of the world.
That is England, where Richard is King. And here is France. We have lands there. Very green.
Will I ever see France?
But you must be king. Here.
Why? She looks sad and guilty. A sound. SIBYLLA looks at: TIBERIAS. She stands.
The king wants you. He needs you.
I cannot bear to look at him. He knows this. It does not mean I do not love him.
(imploring her) Go. (CONTINUED)
Sibylla nods. It is something she knew she must do anyway TIBERIAS stays looking at the boy for a moment.

May God defend you. TIBERIAS goes out. The BOY plays with the candle flame. H touches it with one hand-- and draws the hand back, in pa He touches the flame with his other and (the fingers touc the flame OS) does not draw the hand back.

head_text.subj: INT. THE KING'S DEATHCHAMBER. MOMENTS LATER

text: The KING, wearing his mask, is breathing raggedly. SIBYLL approaches, down the long room. The KingвЂ™s PHYSICIANS b away. She kneels beside her brotherвЂ™s bed, as if at a c at a wake.
Do you remember when I was a boy...
And when you defeated Saladin. You were sixteen... She cries.
You have never not been beautiful. In every act. In every word.
Remember me as I was.
(in tears) I will. I do. The mask moves: a nod. SIBYLLA kisses the mask.
GUY is standing outside as Sibylla comes out. He looks strangely more needy and in love than villainous. SIBYLLA looks at him evenly.
If my son has your knights, you have a wife.
Unless I am made head of the Army we have no bargain. (CONTINUED)

SIBYLLA nods and moves on. INT. THE KINGвЂ™S DEATHCHAMBER. TWILIGHT Move through the columned room. THE KING IS DEAD AND LIES STATE. SIBYLLA kneels at the end of the room. She crosses hersel and stands to leave, but then as if in a dream moves towa the biered, masked, body. She reaches out trembling finge and removes the mask. Here for the first time we see what leprosy has done to the king, her brother. She stumbles b and drops the MASK on the stones. Then, as she looks up, is the Sibylla who will do what must be done. Whatever it be.
Long live the King.
BELLS are tolling, funereally. PEOPLE are wailing in mourning, throwing dust on themselves. A few brighter lig might actually be packing.

location: THE CHURCH OF THE HOLY SEPULCHER. CONTINUOUS

text: Torchlight. All the nobles of the kingdom. The BOY is giv scepter and orb, and crowned by the Patriarch. SIBYLLA is her knees, watching, GUY beside her. The Patriarch turns toward them.
Do you swear before God to be his true regents in peace and war. SIBYLLA and GUY nod, swearing, and are anointed with oil. is given a baton signifying command of the Army. He looks it. Then up.
A CREOSOTE BUSH. A stone falls near it. Another. The thir stone throws a spark, and the bush explodes into flame: t burning bush of Moses.
I do not hear a voice.
Nor I. (CONTINUED)
As the HOSPITALER walks his horse follows him, almost magically.

Do you love her? BALIAN nods. HOSPITALER (CONTвЂ™D) You've followed your conscience. Your heart will mend. Balian stares into the light. HOSPITALER (CONTвЂ™D) You are Marshal of Jerusalem now. Your duty is with the people of the city. No matter who is on the throne. BALIAN nods. The HOSPITALER mounts. HOSPITALER (CONTвЂ™D) I go to pray.
For what?
For the strength to endure what is to come.
The Muslims will come when he is dead.
The reckoning is to come for what was done a hundred years before. The Muslims will never forget. Nor should they. The HOSPITALER wanders away into a mirage.
A TURBANED SERVANT is running, leading the BOYвЂ™S PONY. BOY, his dress now velvet, regal, bounces happily in the saddle. SIBYLLA walks with COUNCILORS.  96.
The BOY sits at a large draped table, swinging his legs, bored. SIBYLLA, tired, finishes writing-- in Arabic!
My lady, are you sure this is wise, to show your intentions to Saladin. Better to let him wonder...

We keep my brotherвЂ™s peace. GUY, overhearing this, bored among the courtiers, rolls h eyes. The KEEPER OF THE SEAL is waiting, with wax hot in a vess of some sort. SIBYLLA puts the paper in front of the boy guides his clumsy hand to sign. DETAIL: вЂњBALDWIN V IERUUSALEMвЂќ SIBYLLA nods. The KEEP OF THE SEAL brings the smoking wax the paper and as he does it dribbles across the BOYвЂ™S H SIBYLLA notices that the BOY is staring out at the garden entranced, oblivious. She covers his hand with her handkerchief. But the PATRIARCH has seen. SIBYLLA, her вЂњmask of officeвЂќ in place. The JERUSALEM pressed into the wax.

The king is tired. I thank you all. INT. THE KINGвЂ™S ROOMS. NIGHT Amidst candles, the boy, lying on his back on a draped be is examined by MUSLIM PHYSICIANS in black as a servant distracts him with a monkey or a Punchinello puppet. SIBY leans against a wall, breathing sharply as if hyperventilating but holding herself together. She sees h son in the kingвЂ™s rooms, surrounded as the king was by physicians...she is wobbly...ashen-faced. A PHYSICIAN examines the boyвЂ™s hand (still with the remains of a bu it) and then moves to the feet. Gently he feels them. The sticks a pin into one. The BOY does not react. The PHYSIC looks up to SIBYLLA, who begins to tremble. The shadow of monkey or the puppet on the wall.  97. INT. SIBYLLAвЂ™S ROOMS. NIGHT SIBYLLA is writing, alone. State papers. TIBERIAS stands of the shadows. He and SIBYLLA stare at each other.
There is a rumor. SIBYLLA raises her eyes.
Call it treason, and kill those who whisper it. (writes) Starting with the Patriarch.
Does the boy have your brother's disease? SIBYLLA slowly nods. She stands, and TIBERIAS embraces he He has known her her entire life.
(hollowly) We must call it a lie. Condemn it outright. Show the boy as active...
As you did with my brother? With his reins tied to his hands? How long before he wears a mask? Will you have one made for him?
I am sorry.
To the Muslims he will deserve it. They will say he deserved it as they said of my brother... How did my boy deserve it? (a beat) Jerusalem is dead, Tiberias. TIBERIAS fears it is true enough.
No kingdom is worth my son alive in hell. (CONTINUED)
(finally) No.
I will go to hell instead.

A brilliant, luminous, day. The BOY is happily riding his pony, holding his LEAD KNIGHT. This time SIBYLLA is leadi him. She is stone-faced. She leads him towards a вЂњsumme houseвЂќ at the end of the garden.
SIBYLLA uncorks a bottle, and pours a cup. Her fingers do tremble. She holds it to the boy who smiles radiantly at mother on the best day of his life, and drinks.
The boyвЂ™s hand opens and the LEAD KNIGHT falls to the f

We see: A KNIGHT. It resolves as BALIAN, riding along the road. He dismounts to drink at rocky stream. He wears mai but no helmet. He looks up and sees (coming down the trac a solitary tree): THREE TEMPLAR KNIGHTS, GuyвЂ™s assassin arrayed across the road. They are heavily armed, enigmati BALIAN mounts, and rides towards them. One rides slightly forward, with a lance. BALIAN lance, only an undrawn sword. lance, and charges BALIAN, no grips his shield. He has no The FIRST TEMPLAR lowers his time to draw a sword, takes the lance on his shield, shatters it. The TEMPLAR takes out a mace. BALIAN hacks him in the teeth with the edge of the heavy shield, unhorsing him. The SECOND TEMPLAR spears in BalianвЂ™s horse. BALIAN hits the ground running, his shi lost. He draws the big sword. The SECOND TEMPLAR rides do with sword raised. BALIAN swings the sword and hits the h in the teeth (which is how a man on foot deals with caval The horse spills its ride. BALIAN runs forward and kills SECOND TEMPLAR, and then as he tries to catch the First TemplarвЂ™s horse is cut across the back of the head by a blow. His hands slip from the leather. He staggers, ready fight. The remaining THIRD TEMPLAR rides at him. Horses r wildly around, raising dust. The remaining Templar, dismounted comes walking out of the dust, a MACE swinging
Is this why you came to the Holy Land? (CONTINUED)
The TEMPLAR looks doubtful. BALIAN is aware of the blood is losing.

Come on. The MACE hums. BALIAN ducks, and bashes in at the manвЂ™s getting inside the mace. The men fight hand to hand. He crawls to the fallen man and after a close struggle (Bali is losing consciousness) crams his dagger into the eye. H lies across the body of the dead man, bleeding from the b of the head.
Torches flare on the battlements. BELLS gong and echo thr the deserted streets.
The doors open. REYNALD looks up. GUY, stunned by developments, leans against the wall. He holds a sword wrapped in its belt. BELLS on sound.
The boy is in heaven. (GUY leans against the wall, nods) Your wife has no more stone than anyone I have known. God protect her. I admire good. I just canвЂ™t do it.
She is in the crypt and will not come out.
Have the Templars removed your problem? GUY nods, hollowly. He gives REYNALD his (ReynaldвЂ™s) sw
Give me a war, Reynald.
That is what I do. GUY walks out leaving the prison door open. BELLS carry o into...  100.

head_text.subj: INT. THE CHURCH OF THE HOLY SEPULCHER. DAY

text: Torchlight. All the nobles of the kingdom. SIBYLLA, looki beautiful, drugged, is crowned by the Patriarch. She sits the throne. As the Patriarch backs away she looks aside a sees: GUYвЂ™S HAND on her shoulder.

REYNALD, armor covered with blood, stands and surveys A SLAUGHTERED MUSLIM CARAVAN. Silks are being dragged from bundles. Purses are being cut from dead Saracens. REYNALD walks through the scene of slaughter. MUSLIM WOMEN are being stripped and raped. REYNALD walks if stunned and ashamed, but still he has done what he has done. REYNALD quire simply cannot help himself.
I am what I am. Someone has to be. He goes up to a captured MUSLIM WOMAN and...Unveils her. swerve up.
That is SaladinвЂ™s sister.
I know.

A GREAT PUBLIC SQUARE, filled with tens and tens of thous of Muslim men. They are acclaiming SALADIN but using the words to praise God. SALADIN raises his palm and the ALLA louder. In a fury Saladin moves away from his balcony and into his palace.
IMAD is looking at his master with a kind of fear.
There will be no quarter.
GodfreyвЂ™s son is lord defender. He is honest. (CONTINUED)
If they do not surrender Jerusalem they die. SALADIN cuts his palm; and with a finger puts a streak of blood on his head.

head_text.subj: INT. THE THRONE ROOM IN JERUSALEM. NIGHT

text: GUY is drinking. Not looking very much like being King wa his best idea. He is listening to a SARACEN MESSENGER.
Where is ibn Barzin?
Who is ibn Barzin?
It is our name for the son of Godfrey.
You will speak to me.

The Sultan will not talk terms. He means to try the Kingdom in the greatest wager of battle yet seen in this land. The Sultan finds us divided. The Sultan says that Jerusalem has now a false king. The Sultan demands the surrender of Jerusalem.
Does he. The SARACEN MESSENGER nods.
What answer do you give to Saladin? GUY takes out his dagger.
This. He kills the SARACEN MESSENGER, driving point through the underjaw and into the brain. He lets the body fall.
Send the head to Damascus. (CONTINUED)
SIBYLLA in her mourning clothes stands shocked in the doorway, blinking. GUY looks up to her.

(mocking her thoughts) вЂњWhat have I done?вЂќ The TEMPLARS and GUYвЂ™S MEN, by prearrangement, kill the PALACE GUARD and HOSPITALERS. GUY walks slowly up to his wife, grabs her face, and kisses her forehead.
You've served your purpose. You poisoned the wrong one. TIBERIAS stepping forward is confronted by GuyвЂ™s PIKEME

I wonвЂ™t confine you. I leave you your power, your knights. You may try civil war. But then the Saracens would see us divided and come in. And so much for ChristвЂ™s kingdom. As they call it in other parts of the world. (a beat) I have the town, I have the palace, I have its guard, I have the Templars, I have the Patriarch, and I have the crown. ItвЂ™s done, Tiberias. I am Jerusalem. (moving away) Assemble the Army.

head_text.subj: EXT. OUTSIDE THE WALLS OF JERUSALEM. DAY

text: The full ARMY OF THE KINGDOM OF JERUSALEM is assembled. Enormous ranks of horsemen, each in their "order" before city walls. Ranks of FOOTSOLDIERS to left and right. TURCOPOLES riding around the fringe, raising dust. The BA OF THE HOLY CROSS flies near GUY'S TENT.

An open-sided affair, a full view of the camp. Horses of nobility of the kingdom held outside. GUY has arranged himself in a thronelike chair at the end of his council table. BARONS in attendance. A commotion outside. GUY goe the ten opening and we see: BALIAN, without armor, walks slowly in past the lines of mounted men at arms, who salute him. Commotion among the FOOTSOLDIERS are well. (CONTINUED)

GUY is too observed to reveal his thoughts on the appeara of Balian. He returns nervously to his chair. BALIAN ente the crowded tent. He looks for a long time at the Templar Master. He and Guy stare at each other.

Now this assemblage of barons is... by some loose definition.. (looks up at Balian) complete. There are those among you who may disagree with our succession but it is war and I...am the king. (looks up nerbously) We march at once. What say this council?
Aye.
No. TIBERIAS looks up and smiles. GUY is not smiling.
There are barons, and barons, my lords. This is a curious one.
If you must have a war, this army must not move away from water.
What he says is true. If you march in the head of this season, you will kill this army.
You have a chance to hold the city. But if you move out against Saladin, this army will be destroyed and the city left defenseless.
When I wish a blacksmith as my advisor in war I will let him know. You will not join this army. (CONTINUED)
Saladin wants you to come out. He is waiting for you to make that mistake. He knows his man. BALIAN goes out. Guy staring after him.
We should meet the enemies of God.
So we shall.
You do so without my knights.
Then I will have the glory. You've had yours, years and years ago, Tiberias. It is time for mine.

head_text.subj: EXT. OUTSIDE THE WALLS OF JERUSALEM. MOMENTS LATER

text: TIBERIAS joins BALIAN, and they walk towards the city gat moving through the ARMY. BALIANвЂ™S MEN and TIBERIASвЂ™ M separate from the army. Reaction on the faces of the men.
The boy is dead.
Did Guy kill him?

No. (Balian looks at him) He was a leper like his uncle. His mother gave him peace. (Balian starts to speak and cannot, nearly stumbles, and Tiberias holds him) She вЂњlet him goвЂќ-- and Jerusalem with him. BALIAN, shattered, nods, and walks on.
We must look to the defenses. When Saladin destroys Guy he will come. TIBERIAS nods. BALIAN sees: the HOSPITALER, mounted, amon other knights of his order. The HOSPITALER rides out. (CONTINUED)
You go with the Army?

With my Order. Have I lived? Will you remember me? What I have said to you? BALIAN nods. HOSPITALER (CONTвЂ™D) I will tell Godfrey what I have seen you become. They clasp hands. Responding to an order OS the HOSPITALE turns horse and rides off with the other knights.

BALIAN moves along the hall, with Almaric and his men. A TEMPLAR GUARD interposes. BALIAN kills him. Another TEMPL begins to draw his sword. BALIAN disarms him and backs hi against the wall, dagger point at his throat. The PATRIAR sees him. BALIAN hands over the TEMPLAR GUARD to Almaric grabs the Patriarch by the throat.
Where is the Queen of Jerusalem?

Guy is head of the army...and of course a husband has rights, even over a Queen... UNDECIDED GUARDS appear. BALIAN cuts the PatriarchвЂ™s pu and throws the purse to the UNDECIDED GUARDS...who now de which way the wind is blowing, take the money, and retrea
Are you a man, my lord bishop, who looks to his own interest? You have that reputation. The PATRIARCH nods. Yes yes yes.
If you obstruct me, I will kill you. There it is.
SIBYLLA is praying. A key clanks in the lock. She turns a sees: (CONTINUED)
BALIAN, framed in the doorway. She stands, and lowers her eyes. BALIAN comes forward.
It does not matter what you have done. What matters is what we do now. Sibylla looks up.
Guy will lose the army. I must prepare to defend the city.
Open the gates...If Saladin comes in his full strength we are not defensible. Not even if the army were here.
I have...decided otherwise. When they come, they will not get in. SIBYLLA looks up as BALIAN moves fast out of the room. Th doorway is now empty.
MONTAGE of BALIAN, unarmored, directing the arrangement o defenses. A broken wall swarming with MASONS. CITIZENS ar armed with PIKES and SPEARS. BALIAN supervises the placem of a BALLISTA. ETC, ETC.
SIBYLLA watches from a high window.

A HUGE SHOT of the desert. At a distance of about a mile, see the ARMY OF JERUSALEM. It is straggling across the pl below two hills understood to be the Horns of Hattin. It no fine вЂњhedgehogвЂќ but a rabble baking in the sun. In shot, a BOOTED FOOT in a stirrup. REVERSE IT to reveal: SALADIN. He is staring, veiled acro Beside him, IMAD. The MULLAH rides up.
God wills it. SALADIN nods. MUSLIM HORSE ride up the hill.  107.
TIBERIAS, staring intently out into the desert, comes alo to find BALIAN, sitting rigidly on the ramparts, drinking water from a skin.
Can you sense it? BALIAN stands and looks out into the desert himself.
I know at least that no riders have come... BALIAN nods.

In THICK SMOKE (obscuring distances), the aftermath of th battle. Dead horses and men, tangled with their enemies. Saracens of the lower classes brawl over purses, arms. (T was, and still is, the greatest Muslim victory of all tim and the Saracens know it: they have smashed not only the of Jerusalem but the Crusades).
SALADIN, stone-faced, walks over the battlefield. IMAD is with him.
Kill the knights of the religious orders. IMAD looks taken aback.

They are fanatics and no peace will ever be made with them. They will think one thing their entire lives, and they will never stop thinking it. (bitterly, staring across the battlefield) Kill them. SALADIN walks on through the smoke.
The TEMPLARS and HOSPITALERS are being butchered one by o by MULLAHS. (CONTINUED)
Most of the holy knights make the sign of the cross and accept martyrdom. Some try to run, an unseemly scrambling the Saracens scream. Our HOSPITALER is brought forward on the bloody ground.
There is no god but God. The HOSPITALER looks up at his executioner and smiles.
I know. The MULLAH after a moment of confusion slashes down.
BALIAN lowers his head. Wind and dust. As if he is aware what has happened. He is still bowing when TiberiasвЂ™ ha touches his shoulder.

Come one. INT. SALADINвЂ™S TENT. LATER CLOSE DETAIL: SNOW is scooped into a cup, and water poure into it. SALADIN takes the cup and with his own hands gives it to GUY, who drinks, not greedily, suspecting what the hospitality means: his life. He hands the cup, thoughtlessly, sidewards to REYNALD, wh also knows what the cup means...and that neither the cup what is means was meant for him.
(quietly) I did not give the cup to Reynald.

(undisturbed, drinks the last drop) I drink water for what it is. SALADIN stabs the smiling REYNALD in the throat. Blood gu out. REYNALD pitches forward on his face. SALADIN kneels besid the dying and choking REYNALD. SALADIN touches his finger REYNALDвЂ™s blood and puts a mark in blood upon his own forehead. (CONTINUED)

REYNALD is dragged out and (as the crowd screams) butcher GUY, on reflection, is more bitter at the nature of his apparent end than afraid of it. He looks up bravely at Saladin. SALADIN (to GUYвЂ™S relief) hands his bloody sci to IMAD.
Were you not close enough to a great king to see how to imitate one? Could you not learn by example? GUY knows he has destroyed the world. Eyes luminous in sm blackened face.
TIBERIAS and BALIAN are galloping with a handful of men i GodfreyвЂ™s livery. BALIAN reins in, staring ahead. He ra his arm, and points.
There.

head_text.subj: THE SKY IS BLACK WITH VULTURES.

text: They ride slowly on, and as they crest a hill, we see, as they do: THE BATTLEGROUND. Ten thousand men lied dead. Dead horses men are torn by vultures. SaladinвЂ™s army has moved on. and TIBERIAS stare. A mound of executed Templars and Hospitalers has attracted the most vultures. TIBERIAS slo makes the sign of the cross. He lowers his head. When he raises his face, he is a new man.
I have given Jerusalem my whole life. All. There is no more.
Tiberias... TIBERIAS takes hold of the cross on his surcoat and tears off. He rides a little to the side, staring towards the 10,000 dead.
First I thought I fought for God. Then I realized I fought for money and land. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)
And then I was ashamed and the King came to me and said: let us try a better world. A better world has been tried and is now impossible.
Tiberias! TIBERIAS looks at him as if for a moment he does not recognize him.
There is no more вЂњJerusalemвЂќ. I go to Cyprus. Will you come.
No.

Saladin must move his army from water to water. You have four days. Perhaps five. God be with you. You are the son of your father. Be without fear. God does love you. He has finished with me. BALIAN takes his hand. TIBERIAS rides off. After him, wit looks of apology at BALIAN, so do, one by one, all the me Balian sits his horse alone.

BALIAN is riding back, hard, to Jerusalem. Out of the low ground before him come--twenty MUSLIM RIDERS, all in whit as if in death-shrouds. BALIAN turns his horse to the right (nearly putting the animal down), and sees: MORE WHITE RIDERS. Within an inst he is surrounded: SALADIN'S GUARD. BALIAN does not bother drawing a weapon. looks for a breakout as the circle closes...but then he s SALADIN. SALADIN rides forward, holding up his palm. The look at each other. Horses circling. SALADIN is veiled, unreadable.
I knew your father. (a beat) He nearly killed me in Lebanon. On a great horse he crashed through my guard, and scattered them. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)
He was not five paces from me when an arrow struck through the eye of his horse. I knew his face...and his quality. We called him ibn Barzin. I did not know he had a son.
He did. He does. 111. WHITE RIDERS come closer. SALADIN disarms BALIAN, taking Godfrey's sword.
If you promise to fight no more against the Muslims, you may go.
If you march on Jerusalem I cannot promise.
I do march on Jerusalem. I will take it as it was taken, in blood. Commoners, court and Queen will die. Every soul.
Then I cannot promise not to fight you.
Your choice is death, or that promise.
I cannot promise.
Then your sentence is death. BALIAN waits for it. Instead of death his is given: GODFR SWORD. Politely.
Every man dies. (he mounts) I will take Jerusalem. I cannot do otherwise. Understand.
I must defend. (CONTINUED)
SALADIN nods, and canters away, his guard galloping after leaving Balian in the dust.

head_text.subj: EXT. THE WALLS OF JERUSALEM. DAY

text: MANGONELS are being hoisted to the towers by Papal troops GATE is being blocked up by Masons, etc. MONTAGE of SIEGE PREPARATIONS, supervised by Balian.
CATTLE and FOOD are coming into the town. BALIAN, in a fu is checking his organized defences. ARMS are being distributed to a crowd.
We must quit the city.
And be massacred on the open road? SaladinвЂ™s cavalry is between us and the sea.
I do not mean the people. I mean us. BALIAN moves on.
(dancing after Balian) We have not enough knights.
(furious) Truly? BALIAN turns to a PEASANT BOY, perhaps of 16.
What is your condition?
I am servant to the Patriarch.
You are a slave. That is my slave!
Is he. BALIAN jumps up on the steps of the Holy Sepulcher. (CONTINUED)

You know who I am. (the crowd goes silent) None of us took this city from Muslims. No Muslim of the great army now coming against us was alive when it was lost. We fight over an offense we did not give, against those who were not alive to be offended. What is Jerusalem? Your holy places overlay the Jewish temple which the Romans pulled down. The Muslim places overlay yours. Which is more holy? The wall? The mosque? This sepulcher? Who has claim? NO ONE has claim... All have claim.
Blasphemy.

We defend the city not to defend these stones, which are either meaningless or have too many meanings, but the people living in these walls who will die unless we do not defend them. Unless we kill the army coming against us every person in Jerusalem will die. Say that God is with you if you want, but I will trust in each of you. Trust in me. I swear not to God but to each of you that with your help I will kill SaladinвЂ™s army in front of these walls. No cheering. He jumps down. To the BOY, holding him.
You are a slave? (the BOY nods) Kneel. The BOY kneels. The PATRIARCH is aghast.
Every man of arms or capable of bearing them, kneel. The CROWD kneels, BOYS, SERGEANTS, MERCHANTS, OLD PEASANT (CONTINUED)

Be without fear in the face of your enemies. Be brave and upright, that God may love thee. Speak the truth even if it leads to your death. Safeguard the helpless. That is your oath. The BOY canвЂ™t believe is. BALIAN hits him.
(to the BOY alone) And thatвЂ™s so you remember it. BALIAN goes to raise the next guy. The ManвЂ™s face raise we see: THE GRAVEDIGGER, now battle-scarred, rich. Balian smiles.
Rise a knight.
Master Blacksmith.
Master Gravedigger. You have come to the right place. He moves on out of the murmuring (and emboldened) crowd. PATRIARCH OF JERUSALEM staring after him.
(nearly crying) Does making a man a knight make him a fight better? BALIAN is surprised by the question.
(very simply) Yes. SIBYLLA has seen it all.
Tents are everywhere on the hills. The SARACEN ARMY is surrounding the city--at prayer. Hundreds of thousands of bow and vocalize in unison. ENGINES are in place. Their c praying. (CONTINUED)

JerusalemвЂ™s ARCHES AND SPEARMEN stare out from the wall the enormous enemy. BALIAN stands on the walls, at a tower. He looks to his s and sees: SIBYLLA. They stand together, windblown, looking out at t deaths. The prayer still continues. Allahu akhbar. Thousands bowi as one.
Forgive me.
I do.
Save the people from what I have done.
I will. SIBYLLA kisses him. BALIAN looks at her heartbroken.
You had better go.

If you wanted the world more, I would love you less. Sibylla moves along the wall. BALIAN looks chaotically ou the MUSLIM army. As prayer stops...A solitary figure beco distinct on a hill: SALADIN. He raises his palm. BALIAN, the wall, does the same.
For GodвЂ™s sake, talk terms.
There are none. (moving along the вЂњlineвЂќ, checking machines, men) Keep your heads down. Take cover when the barrage begins...
One may convert to Islam, and repent later. It can be done. There is dispensation in these cases... (CONTINUED)
Balian looks at the cross on the PatriarchвЂ™s breast. Th does the Patriarch.

You have taught me a great deal about religion. We hear tinkling bells, and laughter. GUY, tied backwards a tiny donkey, with a conical dunce cap on his head, is driven on display along the front of the Muslim Army, bel the walls of Jerusalem. He keeps his dignity as much as possible. SIBYLLA watches. BALIAN now with ALMARIC watches from the walls as SALADIN rides alone onto a hill, with his guard. He looks towards city. Almaric crosses himself as one cry of Allahu Akhbar rings out.

Here it comes. The enormous BOMBARDMENT commences. DEFENDERS, as Balian instructed, take cover on the walls. SARACEN ENGINES exec one of the largest bombardments of the day. INT. SIBYLLAвЂ™S ROOMS. MOMENTS LATER SIBYLLA has seen it all. She removes her jewels. Then beg to remove her fine, complicated, clothes. She puts on a g shift, staring into nothingness.

MUSLIM INFANTRY (with LADDERMEN) moves forward, slowly, a then at a run. CROSSBOWMEN slaughter the men below. ENGINES FIRE and as the MUSLIM ARMY screams and Saracen d beat, a SIEGE TOWER, ARCHES firing from its platform, is pushed towards the wall. It has caught fire in two or thr places. LADDERMEN run alongside the tower. SPRAYS OF STON from Mangonels tear through the Saracens and rock the tow

head_text.subj: EXT. THE WALLS OF JERUSALEM. LATER

text: DEFENDERS wait. CROSSBOWMEN fire and FLAMING ARROWS are fired. BALIAN watches. The SIEGE TOWER comes within ten f of the wall and as a great RAMP descends, hundreds of MUS charge forward into PIKEMEN. They are staved off, Balian the center of the repulse catches an arrow through the le wrist. (CONTINUED)

(clutching the arm) Now! From a TOWER to the side, two GRAPNELS are thrown. Were i not Balian the artificer managing things, this may or may have been effective, but the instant the grapnels catch ( are hand-tightened), BALIAN waves his arm. The two lines to a DERRICK which is holding up a stone the size of a sm cottage. A line is cut (killing, as it snaps, the man who it), and the weight of the stone jerks the SIEGE TOWER to pieces. It literally explodes. Debris, burning beams, kno MUSLIM LADDERMEN off the walls. The wreckage collapses ba on the infantry tightly packed behind the tower, killing scores. BALIAN watches: and nods at Almaric.

BALIAN moves through the rows of wounded and dead. A PHYSICIAN cuts the jugular of a smashed man and the blood caught in a basin. BALIAN sits to have his hand bound. Th FINGER is parted from the hand, and put in a basin. The h is washed, and wrapped. A CLOAKED WOMAN does the bandagin She raises her eyes. Sibylla. BALIAN looks at her evenly. Then wordlessly he embraces her, staring past her bent he SIBYLLA weeping.

head_text.subj: EXT. THE WALLS OF JERUSALEM. DAY

text: SPEARMEN knock over the ladders that have been gotten up. melee along the walls. BALIAN, moving through smoke, wave his arm, and GREEK FIRE is flung straight down into the infantry. As hundreds of Saracens burn...CROSSBOWMEN en m come forward to crowd the walls and begin to slaughter th Saracens.

head_text.subj: EXT. ANOTHER WALL OF JERUSALEM. LATER

text: As MUSLIMS in the thousands mass with ladders beneath ano wall....GREAT WOODEN TRAYS running the length of the wall levered up by a hundred men, and pour stones down, smashi thousands of tightly-massed men (the lumber follows, tumb down). As a SECOND WAVE of Saracens presses forward over smashed men, GREEK FIRE jets from pipes fixed to the wall igniting men as well as the smashed wooden trays. Men on run everywhere, and fall burning.

location: A LESSER GATE OF JERUSALEM. CONTINUOUS

text: As MUSLIMS advance, tens, scores, fall into concealed kil pits of sharpened stakes, and even as they are surprised them...begin to reconsider the assault, an arches fires a flaming arrow into...A FIELD OF PITCH. (CONTINUED)

An area of about an acre has been covered with pitch and straw and dirt. It goes up like an oil-rig fire, fierce enough to drive defenders back from the walls. This part the Muslim army is entirely incinerated.
CATAPULTS are being worked non-stop by the Saracens, and walls are being struck, hard. The walls are coming down.

Concentrated catapult fire is collapsing a wall. It sudde shivers down, from the bottom, the stone pouring out into great apron. And the MUSLIM ARMY is ready. SALADIN rides along the front of his force.
Not one alive. Not one.

A SHIELD WALL forms, BALIAN directing it. Defenders (all knights there are, including the first BOY made Knight) g shield to shield. ARCHES and CROSSBOWMEN take elevated positions behind. As Muslim army of thousands advances at a run, ready to kill Christians at a single rush, BALIAN looks to his left in shield wall and sees: THE GRAVEDIGGER. They nod at each other. The SARACEN ARCHES fire a volley of arrows and the INFANTRY charges. This is their chance: they will take Jerusalem at this rush and are not afraid of martyrdom. N arrows oppose them: merely the waiting knights in the bro wall. But they break on the line, hacked down, man after by the heavily armored knights. There is no need to screa keep the line: the line is kept, by the knights and the в knightsвЂќ with them. Dissolve in the fighting to:

head_text.subj: EXT. THE BREACH IN THE WALL. DAWN

text: BALIAN, blood-covered and thirsty, wakes from a doze. KNI are leaning on their swords, or lying on the ground, coughing. We see that the line of defense is marked by immense piles of dead. Saracens tangled with Europeans in the breech in the wall. Hundreds of dead: thousands perha The defense of the breach has nearly killed the SaladinвЂ infantry. BALIAN wanders, stumbling, among the bodies. Th GRAVEDIGGER lies dead, hacked across the face.
Remember me in France. (CONTINUED)
ON SOUND (as Balian looks at the butchery by daylight): T MUSLIM ARMY is called to prayer. From the walls of Jerusa we see the whole army praying.

(covered with blood) They will ask for terms. They will ask for terms. EXT. BEFORE SALADINвЂ™S TENT. DAY Saladin waits mildly as BALIAN comes through the crowd, escorted. As he comes through: the Arabs look at him with interest, many salaaming. BALIAN, awkwardly, returns the salaam. GUY, no longer tie the donkey, is being treated as SaladinвЂ™s guest. Rubbin wrists and staring at Balian with a strange look of hatre and admiration mixed.
We must discuss Jerusalem. ItвЂ™s King (nods at Guy) has surrendered it but there seems to be a difficulty.
You offered no quarter and we ask one. What has changed?
Will you yield the city?
Before I lose it I will burn it to the ground. Your holy places. Ours. Every last thing in Jerusalem that drives men mad.
I wonder if it would not be better if you did. (looks reflectively at the city) You will destroy it?
Every stone. And every Christian knight you kill will take ten Saracens with him. You will kill your army here and never raise another. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)
I swear to God that to take this city will be the end of you.
You cannot stand another assault.
Make one, and we will see. GUY is watching, fascinated, what he might have been.
Your city is full of women, and children. There will be disease, soon, from the dead. If my army will die, and so will your city.
(swallows, knowing that it is true) Do you offer terms? I ask none. SALADIN walks apart. Long pause. Then he turns.

I will give every soul safe-conduct to Christian lands. Every soul. The women, the children, the old, and all your knights and soldiers. Your Queen. Your King... (GUY tenses) I leave to what God will make of him. MULLAHS object. BALIAN staring at SALADIN stares at Balia with hatred.
No one will be robbed or harmed, I swear to God.
The Christians butchered every Muslim within the walls when they took this city.
I am not those men. I am Saladin.
Then on these terms I surrender Jerusalem.  121.
BALIAN comes back in through the gate. SIBYLLA stands the in her simple clothing.
We surrender the city in the morning, and will be safely escorted to the sea.
The nobles...
Everyone is safe to go. I would not have surrendered otherwise. SIBYLLA looks distraught at Jerusalem.
If this is GodвЂ™s kingdom he can dispose of it as he likes. Your brotherвЂ™s kingdom was here. (he touches her heart) That kingdom is not surrendered.

head_text.subj: EXT. INSIDE THE WALLS OF JERUSALEM. LATER

text: In the square before the palace Christians with their goo loaded are forming caravans. BALIAN, moving among them, mounted, suddenly looks around as...GUY, fully armed, lea destrier over some baggage and slams at a gallop into BalianвЂ™s horse. BALIANвЂ™S horse goes down screaming. B rolls in the dust. Guy rides around him.
They say now you are beloved by God. How much of that am I to take? There is already a song about Jerusalem and its false and wicked king. GUY takes a battle axe from a retainer.

They would have tried to marry her to a bucket, or a Saracen if it would have kept their world intact. I donвЂ™t mind that you fucked her, for are we not all French...but... (smiles) I am not a bad man. I am only a man making my way. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)
I am simply making my way. As all men are...except for you. Do you think you are a perfect knight? Do you? Do you?

I am not the man who lost the Kingdom of Jerusalem. As Balian walks away, GUY turns his horse to ride him dow A CHORUS OF KNIGHTS dismount and fight him. GUY realizes he must. He dismounts. He draws his sword. BALIAN waits for him. GUY moves like lightning and cuts a gash in BalianвЂ™s face. BALIAN waits. In a quick passage, Guy disarms Balian, who scrambles and picks up his sword again. There is no quest Guy is state of the art. BALIAN stands waiting. GUY moves kill him. The Men collide, and GUY, spinning away, eludes backswing, catches the blade with his hand, drives it dow into the ground, and returns a blow that would have cut o BalianвЂ™s head--except that Balian parries it, surprisin KNIGHTS and MUSLIMS crowd close, shouting. They know thei sport: and out of nowhere they are at the World Cup. GUY really lays in--state of the art--and Balian, clumsily, m every blow. The two men go at it for sixty seconds straig in an exhausting high speed flurry which includes blows i the face with gloved fists. GUY with a broken nose, breat hard (presumably seeing stars), takes a low guard, and BALIAN, wounded twice, takes a high one. A SARACEN KNIGHT makes a detailed bet with a CHRISTIAN ONE. GUY is still surprised by the blood coming from his nose and is repell Balian almost idly. BALIAN missed a blow and crashes into wall. GuyвЂ™s sword striking where BalianвЂ™s head was a before. BALIAN lunges and GUY, letting him pass, crashes pommel of his sword down on the back of hi head. BALIAN sprawls on the cobbles. GUY goes after him, cuts, misses, wounded in the side by a thrust. GUY parries a second blo and stabs BALIAN (we cannot tell where or how badly) and attacks violently, relentlessly. The crowd follows the exhausted fighters, who face each other, bleeding, breathless, barely on their feet.

Water. It is given him in a skin by one of his knights. GUY goes forward purposefully, to kill BALIAN. BALIAN, staggering, waits. GUY cuts low, Balian, out of breath, barely parrie GUY advances to kill him. BALIAN waits, at the high guard (CONTINUED)
BALIAN is cut, badly, in the next pass. BALIAN takes the вЂњhigh guardвЂќ again. He watches Guy (which is to say h death) advance.

(advancing) вЂњBe brave and upright that God may love thee. Be without fear in the face of your enemies.вЂќ We've all heard the words. How dare you believe them. How dare you. GUY goes for the kill in a move weвЂ™ve seen before. BALI parries as he once did with GODFREY but instead of losing sword as he did long ago in the French wood he meets the blow and then cuts Guy across the throat. GUY falls to his knees, trying to speak. He pitches forwa BALIAN, holding Godfrey's sword, stares down at him.

BALIAN, his wounds bound by MUSLIM PHYSICIANS, stands. Th PHYSICIANS back away respectfully. He moves into the corridor. MUSLIMS are moving through the palace, taking possession. BALIAN looks into TIBERIASвЂ™ ROOM. The room all MUSLIM CLERKS, going through papers. Balian looks aro and sees that SALADIN is standing beside him, alone.
So.
My lord.
I admire the Franks for their courage. It is said that I have learned chivalry from them. Have you heard this? BALIAN laughs. Saladin smiles.
вЂњChivalryвЂќ. It is like faith. When it is true it is good. (hands on BalianвЂ™s shoulder) I like nothing better than an honorable man. Starts to go. (CONTINUED)
What is Jerusalem worth?
Nothing. SALADIN is now walking back along the hall of the capture palace.

Everything. INT. SIBYLLAвЂ™S ROOMS. MOMENTS LATER SIBYLLA is sitting before a dressing-mirror. A distorting sheet of polished metal. Staring at an image which is unclear. She is aware of Balian behind her.
I am still the Queen of Acre, of Tripolis, of Ascalon.
And I am still a knight. And that is all. She stands, and looks at him. BALIAN stares at her.
What shall I decide?
It is simple. Decide not to be a Queen and I will come to you. BALIAN has come to the end of the room. He hesitates; and then goes out through the curtains.
A very orderly Christian evacuation. BALIAN joins it, on foot. IMAD appears, holding the magnificent horse that Ba gave him some time ago.
(wrily) It is not a very good horse. I will not keep it. (Balian takes the bridle) We will meet again.
If we do not? (CONTINUED)

Taking it poorly bakes no bread. IMAD walks away into the crowd. Balian leads his horse saddened; but free. GUYвЂ™S KNIGHTS trudge past and each them salute Balian. He returns the nod; rides along the h stream of refugees...all of whom he has saved. As he begi to be recognized...he pulls the hood of his cloak over hi head. As he looks back at Jerusalem... SARACEN ENGINEERS on top of the church throw down the cro that surmounts it. It crashes to the stones in front of t Temple and is broken to pieces by Saracens. MUSLIMS are taking possession of the temple. SALADIN is walking, bein cheered. MUSLIMS on rooftops, in the streets, acclaiming Saladin.
Rose-water is being splashed on the flags of what has bee Christian church. It is being purified by MULLAHS. SALADI stands in the doorway with IMAD and the MULLAH.

God has favored us with victory. All the glory is God's. SALADIN walks away from the Mullah. The MULLAH would foll but IMAD stops him. SALADIN washes, preparing to pray alo He lays his mat, and, lowering his head, prays.

head_text.subj: EXT. THE ROAD TO THE COAST. DAY, (ENDING ONE)

text: The city is no longer visible. THE CHRISTIAN REFUGEES, escorted by Muslim horsemen, trudge through the desert. A WOMAN walks along the edge of the stony road. BALIAN move along the line. At first he almost passes the woman. He r alongisde her for a while. Then dismounts. BALIAN walks h horse beside the dusty figure.
A Queen never walks.
No. (a beat) And yet I am walking.
Some say that Jerusalem is the center of the world for forgiveness. For myself, I call it here. (CONTINUED)

SIBYLLA nods, and keeps walking beside him. BALIAN leads horse on, exhausted. They walk together towards the sea. REFUGEES sing in French, walking through the Holy Land, heading towards the distant sea. BALIAN tears the cross from his tunic but cannot throw it the ground. He puts it in his sleeve. Fantastical SARACEN KNIGHTS ride along the column, silk billowing, singing th own song in Arabic. BALIAN watches them pass, then rides on, hooded, head dow In a perfect MATCH, SNOW begins to fly past his bent head turns his horse, dismounts, and we see that he is at the forge. He stands, looking around at the land, the orchard SOUND: HORSES. BALIAN finally stands and looks, raising h hood. CRUSADERS. THE LION OF ENGLAND. Gold on a red tunic RICHARDвЂ™S KNIGHT We crusade to recover the Kingdom of Jerusalem.
You go to where the men speak Italian and then continue till they speak something else. RICHARDвЂ™S KNIGHT We have come by this road to find the lord who was defender of Jerusalem.
(bowing) I am the blacksmith. RICHARD COUER DE LION sits his horse, staring at Balian. CRUSADERS pass behind.
And I am the king of England.

I am the blacksmith. He bows. RICHARD COUER DE LION looks at Balian knowing ve well who he is. (He sees the armor lashed to a packhorse) But he nods and rides on. BALIAN turns from the passing Crusaders and enters his old kitchen garden to see A YOUN TREE. It is one of the trees planted by his wife. He touc the leaves. Balian raises his hood against the falling sn and moves on to turns to see, at a distance, SIBYLLA, watching him. (CONTINUED)
BALIAN walks his horse to join her.
BALIAN AND SIBYLLA canter through the crossroads and past local lordвЂ™s castle without looking back. BLACK.
